title: ELEANOR & PARK (PART ONE)
body:
SUMMARY: S.H.I.E.L.D Agent Eleanor Garvey has been assigned to a retreat in the woods with Steve Rogers in order to catch a perp smuggling illegal Asguardian technology into the city by orders of Loki. During the retreat they’re ordered to attract no attention to themselves and be suspicious of anyone and everyone, in order to do so Steve is forced to change his name to ensure their anonymity.

A/N: Yes, like the Rainbow Rowell book, Eleanor and Park are at it again, but this time in the form of this silly series I will attempt to write and curate this misshapen clay ball. That analogy made no sense and my apologies. I am British, so if there is a terminology for something in American I will most likely not know, correct me if it bothers you that much but chances are you knew what I meant tin the first place so it doesn’t matter?

I’m super sorry this feels like you’re starting in the middle of some kind of relationship or romance, it’s not. I tried to make it as clear as I could consistently, but when the opportunity for snuggling was there I COULD NOT pass it up. Again, I’m sorry.

WARNINGS: very fluffy, super bad and short

The room was still and the rustic vibe of the cabin had settled over us like a second blanket. Snuggled into our bed, we faced opposite walls and counted how many second there were in between each rumble of thunder. It was during these seconds I would reflect back on how I got myself into the retreat in the first place, it was for work no doubt, as a self proclaimed work-a-holic it was hard not to find myself in another country for my job. This time was different however, I had been partnered up with Steve Rogers, my colleague, and we were to retrieve illegal Asguardian technology that was going to go through the city and to Loki. It was our job to stop them. We did, but it was difficult to not take advantage of the situation.

Two days into the retreat and we’d already prevented the trade and still with five more days left to go, we deserved a little TLC. My body had sunken into the bed, further than I’d anticipated, and I was forced to use Steve as some sort of anchor to keep me from suffocating. With him asleep this was a simple enough task, I just had to figure out a way to get out of the ‘romantic’ position before he woke up and things got awkward.

‘Steve?’ I whispered, gritting my teeth in anticipation as he stirred and rolled over in his sleep. I allowed my shoulders to slump when he didn’t even open his eyes, I cautiously slid closer to him with the cold of the storm’s finger tips tickling my back. The closer to him I got, the warmer I felt, I was stiff and uncomfortable, but I was safe from the icy outside.

‘El.’ he mumbled gruffly, ‘El what are you doing?’ he put his hands on my back as if to push me away in disgust and discomfort, I was surprised to feel his palm rubbing back gently, like I were a delicate flower petal. At last he realised I wouldn’t answer and moved his hand over my torso and pulled me in closer, he shivered as a draft of cold morning air slithered through the ajar window. Try as I might to grab the edge of the bed to keep myself from getting any further to him, the bed was too damn soft to withstand my desperate grip. His beard tickled my shoulder blades and his bear hug of steel did not cease until later that morning when breakfast was being prepared.

title: Dark Thoughts
body:
Bucky x Reader (ish?)

Warnings: Drinking, swearing, dark thoughts, thoughts of depression and just all around sad theme. 

So this is a request I got and I pulled from some personal experiences- I hope this is close to what you were looking for, anon. Also, as a side thing- this brought out a little dark side to me that I don’t like and I’ve been working really hard on getting away from- so I’m going to limit the dark requests for the moment- I hope everyone understands! :)

anonymous asked:

could you do a bucky reader where she has a bad dream and then she wakes up and it brings back bad memories like a form a ptsd but from emotional abuse? and she feels all panicky and then bucky comes in and looks after her?

Masterlist   ||   Ko-Fi

——————-

You had been part of the Avengers for months now but had refused to live at the compound. It had been a little tough since you had to travel back and forth often but it was your wish. You hadn’t lived with someone since… no.

You shook your head, trying to clear it before entering the conference room you were supposed to meet everyone in.

“You alright?” A soft voice came from behind and you jumped a little.

“Jesus, Buck.” You nudged his arm, “How long you been standing there?”

He shrugged and nudged you back, “Long enough.” He smiled as his eyes met yours.

You turned back towards the door and cleared your throat, “Let’s do this.”

—

They were picking a couple of people to go on a reconnaissance mission and it was your turn to go next- and to be honest you were worried about it. You hadn’t had to be on an overnight mission before and given how much sleep you had been getting lately, you weren’t sure about how well you were going to do.

You walked out of your place and locked the door behind you, rolling your eyes when you saw a guy in the hall passed out again and stepped over him towards the front door. You opened it and saw Bucky standing there. He was staring at you with a frown.

“What?”

He sighed and shook his head, “It’s incredible that you live here.”

You sighed back, looking around, “Where’s our ride?”

He nodded towards the bike in front of you and you snorted, “You scared to hold on, doll?” He smirked as he threw you a helmet.

You laughed and shook your head, “I’m not, are you?” You took the keys off his belt loop and threw your leg over the bike, looking back.

He laughed, putting his helmet on and throwing his leg over- scooting behind you rather closely, holding onto your sides.

You rode off and quickly moved towards the quinjet, a little too aware of the placement of his hands. Getting there, you waited for him to move and it took him a minute.

“Come on, gramps, I wanna get there today.” You mocked with a small smirk and felt him rumble from behind you.

It was a few hours off and the ride turned out to have a lot of nagging and teasing which took your mind off of darker thoughts that seemed to be edging in today, as much as you wished they wouldn’t.

Arriving at the hotel, you both went in and got situated in the room- the one you would be looking out of.

No one had told you it only had one bed in it, or that the bed was going to be ten feet away from the lookout spot where you were supposed to be gaining intel from.

You sighed as you threw your bag down and raided the mini fridge, grabbing an expensive can of beer and sitting down in a chair to look through the room service menu.

“You want something to eat?” You asked without peering up over the menu.

“Sure- just get two of whatever you’re getting. That includes that drink of yours.”

“Coming right up.” You winked over to him before turning towards the phone and placing an order. You walked over towards the mini fridge again and grabbed another can and set it down in front of Bucky, helping him with the equipment.

“So who’s going to be on first watch?” Bucky asked, opening his can after you were done setting up.

“I’ll be on both watches.” You mumbled, raising the can to your lips again.

He chuckled before realizing you were serious, “Oh come on, doll. You have to get some sleep.”

You sighed and thanked room service for their impeccable timing, not wanting to start an argument. You stood and strode over to the door, opening it and bringing the cart inside yourself and nodding a thanks before bolting the door shut again.

Looking under the lids, you laughed. “I think I went a little overboard with the quantity.”

Bucky stood and rubbed his hands together, “Good, I’m hungry.”

You went back to joking and eating and drinking while keeping a lookout and soon it got late.

“I’ll take first watch, okay?” Bucky stated, nodding towards the bed. “At least try for a couple hours.”

You sighed, going to the bathroom to get ready for bed. You came out and laid down, staring at the end table for a while. You were determined not to let those thoughts and memories come back- you had been working so hard for so long to get rid of them.

At some point, you must of dozed off because you woke with a start and a panicked breath.

“Woah, you okay doll?” Bucky asked from the other side of the room and you passed by him to get to the bathroom.

You slid down the wall and into a ball, shutting your eyes and rocking slightly.

“Stop-” You whispered to yourself, “He can’t hurt you anymore.” You tried to stay calm but you could feel the tears coming on, afraid that Bucky would hear you outside of the room.

He lightly tapped the door after another minute and you shouted, your voice cracking, “I’m fine.”

“Doll-”

“Keep a lookout.” You said back in a harsh tone, lowering your head into your hands.

Another moment later there was a splintering sound and your head snapped back up, seeing Bucky at the door- he had broken the area around the lock.

“Don’t you understand what ‘I’m fine’ is?” You asked, an unfortunate tear running down your cheek.

“Don’t you understand I know what a fake ‘I’m fine’ is?” He asked back, stepping towards you.

Your breath caught, “Please, leave.” You asked, more desperation than anything in your voice.

He stopped moving towards you and knelt down so you two were eye level. His brows were furrowed and his expression worried. “What’s wrong?”

“Nothing.” You growled back to him, your face returning back to its position in your hands as you focused on breathing, the impending panic attack coming in. “Leave.” You said again, this time much weaker as the start of it came on.

Your mind lost its focus, a million thoughts crashing in on you at once as you remembered things you wanted forgotten with every fiber of your being. Your breath shortened and you flung your legs out to try and let your lungs get more air.

“Doll-” Your eyes snapped to him, waiting to see him mocking you, “Breathe in-” He waited and you did so, “You’re okay,” He stated and then he motioned for you to breathe out. He asked you over and over to do this and after five minutes or so your breathing returned closer to normal, the panic lowering a bit.

You waited and sniffled a little, “How did you know that would work?”

He met your eyes, “You aren’t the only one with panic attacks.”

You paused, letting that sink in. “One of Earth’s mightiest Avengers has troubles too?”

He snorted but his face went back to worry, “Whatever it is you’re going through, you shouldn’t be alone through it.” He scooted closer, and he was only an arms length away. “You never have to tell me what it is that’s causing it but let me help you.” He asked, his face sill soft, unmocking.

“Why make my problems yours?”

“I’m asking you to.” He responded without skipping a beat, his hand reaching out towards you and you flinched away. He immediately retracted his hand, trying to coax you into a safe feeling.

—

Once returning from the mission, Bucky didn’t mention what happened in front of anyone. He did, however, turn to you and ask you to promise something in front of your building.

“What?” You turned around, facing the door.

“That if you need me for any reason, you’ll call me. Even when you don’t want to- especially then.” He spoke softly again.

You paused, thinking about just walking into the building without answering him. He probably sensed this and grabbed your wrist with a little squeeze.

Your eyes shut, another memory popping into your head from before. “Fine.” You whispered, shaking loose from his grasp before walking inside- not looking back.

You rubbed your face after locking your door and throwing your bag onto the couch.

You should be over this, why were you reverting? You went into the kitchen and grabbed a beer out of the fridge before sitting on the couch, lost in thought.

–

“Y/N, come here now.” He had spoken and you instantly did as he asked. He smiled as his arm wrapped around you. “Be a good girl and grab me a drink.”

You nodded, leaping up from your spot towards the kitchen. Opening the door you noticed there were no more left and a cold chill ran over you. You grabbed your keys from the table and walked back into the front room. “I have to run to the store-”

“What?” He asked, his attention snapping back towards you. You shrank back a little and tried to repeat yourself. He stood, “You telling me you didn’t even have the decency to think about me? To get me something to help me unwind after a long day?”

You shook your head and he spoke again.

“Now I have to wait for you?” He raised his voice and then lowered it again, which made it worse, “You are an ungrateful piece of shit. I’ve taken you in and looked after you-”

–

Your eyes snapped open, trying to push the thoughts back again.

“Fuck off.” You spoke, standing and walking towards the fridge for another drink.

Hours later, the flashbacks still poured in at random no matter how hard you tried to drink them away.

You sighed, unwillingly pulling your phone out of your pocket and your thumb hovering over Bucky’s number. You slammed your fist on the table and went to the fridge for another drink, the last thing you want to do is have someone else here. Especially now.

You groaned and downed your drink, clicking the call button before you could think about it and raised it towards your ear while getting up for yet another drink.

“Y/N?” He answered on the third ring.

“Hey.” You spoke into the phone, closing the fridge.

“How are you?” He spoke again, softly.

You sighed a little into the phone, cracking open your drink and taking a sip, pausing. “Look-” You spoke finally, after a minute of silence, “I told you I’d call if I was… anyways. I did.” You waited for a moment and then you heard him breathe, “This was a stupid idea, I’ll talk to you later.” You closed your eyes and hung up the phone, throwing it over onto your recliner on the other side of the room.

Another drink later, there was a knock on your door. You groaned and waited for them to leave or figure out they were at the wrong door but it came again- you stood up and angrily threw open your door with a, “What?”

Your eyes met those of Bucky who didn’t wait at all, just stepped inside, shut your door and pulled you into a hug. You paused, wanting to back away or joke but instead you burst into tears.

He held you for a long time like that, eventually moving over to the couch and stroking your hair, staying with you overnight.

–

He had done this a half a dozen times over the last month and you had finally told him, bit by bit, why you were like this. You told him how long ago it had happened, how long it had lasted and what were the kinds of things that you were used to from it.

Instead of insisting you shouldn’t have stayed or judged you or told you to calm down about it, he calmly listened, nodded his head and stroked your hair until you calmed down and fell asleep.

Eventually, he talked you into moving into the Avengers building with everyone, away from the shitty area of town you thought you deserved. He stayed with you most nights and became a person you needed to see and share things with.

He was one of the people that helped you get over your darkest thoughts, year by year- and someone who had never let you down.

—————–

anonymous asked:

could you do a bucky reader where she has a bad dream and then she wakes up and it brings back bad memories like a form a ptsd but from emotional abuse? and she feels all panicky and then bucky comes in and looks after her?

Masterlist   ||   Ko-Fi

——————-

You shook your head, trying to clear it before entering the conference room you were supposed to meet everyone in.

“You alright?” A soft voice came from behind and you jumped a little.

“Jesus, Buck.” You nudged his arm, “How long you been standing there?”

He shrugged and nudged you back, “Long enough.” He smiled as his eyes met yours.

You turned back towards the door and cleared your throat, “Let’s do this.”

[[MORE]]

—

They were picking a couple of people to go on a reconnaissance mission and it was your turn to go next- and to be honest you were worried about it. You hadn’t had to be on an overnight mission before and given how much sleep you had been getting lately, you weren’t sure about how well you were going to do.

You walked out of your place and locked the door behind you, rolling your eyes when you saw a guy in the hall passed out again and stepped over him towards the front door. You opened it and saw Bucky standing there. He was staring at you with a frown.

“What?”

He sighed and shook his head, “It’s incredible that you live here.”

You sighed back, looking around, “Where’s our ride?”

He nodded towards the bike in front of you and you snorted, “You scared to hold on, doll?” He smirked as he threw you a helmet.

You laughed and shook your head, “I’m not, are you?” You took the keys off his belt loop and threw your leg over the bike, looking back.

He laughed, putting his helmet on and throwing his leg over- scooting behind you rather closely, holding onto your sides.

You rode off and quickly moved towards the quinjet, a little too aware of the placement of his hands. Getting there, you waited for him to move and it took him a minute.

“Come on, gramps, I wanna get there today.” You mocked with a small smirk and felt him rumble from behind you.

It was a few hours off and the ride turned out to have a lot of nagging and teasing which took your mind off of darker thoughts that seemed to be edging in today, as much as you wished they wouldn’t.

Arriving at the hotel, you both went in and got situated in the room- the one you would be looking out of.

No one had told you it only had one bed in it, or that the bed was going to be ten feet away from the lookout spot where you were supposed to be gaining intel from.

You sighed as you threw your bag down and raided the mini fridge, grabbing an expensive can of beer and sitting down in a chair to look through the room service menu.

“You want something to eat?” You asked without peering up over the menu.

“Sure- just get two of whatever you’re getting. That includes that drink of yours.”

“Coming right up.” You winked over to him before turning towards the phone and placing an order. You walked over towards the mini fridge again and grabbed another can and set it down in front of Bucky, helping him with the equipment.

“So who’s going to be on first watch?” Bucky asked, opening his can after you were done setting up.

“I’ll be on both watches.” You mumbled, raising the can to your lips again.

He chuckled before realizing you were serious, “Oh come on, doll. You have to get some sleep.”

You sighed and thanked room service for their impeccable timing, not wanting to start an argument. You stood and strode over to the door, opening it and bringing the cart inside yourself and nodding a thanks before bolting the door shut again.

Looking under the lids, you laughed. “I think I went a little overboard with the quantity.”

Bucky stood and rubbed his hands together, “Good, I’m hungry.”

You went back to joking and eating and drinking while keeping a lookout and soon it got late.

“I’ll take first watch, okay?” Bucky stated, nodding towards the bed. “At least try for a couple hours.”

You sighed, going to the bathroom to get ready for bed. You came out and laid down, staring at the end table for a while. You were determined not to let those thoughts and memories come back- you had been working so hard for so long to get rid of them.

At some point, you must of dozed off because you woke with a start and a panicked breath.

“Woah, you okay doll?” Bucky asked from the other side of the room and you passed by him to get to the bathroom.

You slid down the wall and into a ball, shutting your eyes and rocking slightly.

“Stop-” You whispered to yourself, “He can’t hurt you anymore.” You tried to stay calm but you could feel the tears coming on, afraid that Bucky would hear you outside of the room.

He lightly tapped the door after another minute and you shouted, your voice cracking, “I’m fine.”

“Doll-”

“Keep a lookout.” You said back in a harsh tone, lowering your head into your hands.

Another moment later there was a splintering sound and your head snapped back up, seeing Bucky at the door- he had broken the area around the lock.

“Don’t you understand what ‘I’m fine’ is?” You asked, an unfortunate tear running down your cheek.

“Don’t you understand I know what a fake ‘I’m fine’ is?” He asked back, stepping towards you.

Your breath caught, “Please, leave.” You asked, more desperation than anything in your voice.

He stopped moving towards you and knelt down so you two were eye level. His brows were furrowed and his expression worried. “What’s wrong?”

“Nothing.” You growled back to him, your face returning back to its position in your hands as you focused on breathing, the impending panic attack coming in. “Leave.” You said again, this time much weaker as the start of it came on.

Your mind lost its focus, a million thoughts crashing in on you at once as you remembered things you wanted forgotten with every fiber of your being. Your breath shortened and you flung your legs out to try and let your lungs get more air.

“Doll-” Your eyes snapped to him, waiting to see him mocking you, “Breathe in-” He waited and you did so, “You’re okay,” He stated and then he motioned for you to breathe out. He asked you over and over to do this and after five minutes or so your breathing returned closer to normal, the panic lowering a bit.

You waited and sniffled a little, “How did you know that would work?”

He met your eyes, “You aren’t the only one with panic attacks.”

You paused, letting that sink in. “One of Earth’s mightiest Avengers has troubles too?”

He snorted but his face went back to worry, “Whatever it is you’re going through, you shouldn’t be alone through it.” He scooted closer, and he was only an arms length away. “You never have to tell me what it is that’s causing it but let me help you.” He asked, his face sill soft, unmocking.

“Why make my problems yours?”

“I’m asking you to.” He responded without skipping a beat, his hand reaching out towards you and you flinched away. He immediately retracted his hand, trying to coax you into a safe feeling.

—

Once returning from the mission, Bucky didn’t mention what happened in front of anyone. He did, however, turn to you and ask you to promise something in front of your building.

“What?” You turned around, facing the door.

“That if you need me for any reason, you’ll call me. Even when you don’t want to- especially then.” He spoke softly again.

You paused, thinking about just walking into the building without answering him. He probably sensed this and grabbed your wrist with a little squeeze.

Your eyes shut, another memory popping into your head from before. “Fine.” You whispered, shaking loose from his grasp before walking inside- not looking back.

You rubbed your face after locking your door and throwing your bag onto the couch.

You should be over this, why were you reverting? You went into the kitchen and grabbed a beer out of the fridge before sitting on the couch, lost in thought.

–

“Y/N, come here now.” He had spoken and you instantly did as he asked. He smiled as his arm wrapped around you. “Be a good girl and grab me a drink.”

You nodded, leaping up from your spot towards the kitchen. Opening the door you noticed there were no more left and a cold chill ran over you. You grabbed your keys from the table and walked back into the front room. “I have to run to the store-”

“What?” He asked, his attention snapping back towards you. You shrank back a little and tried to repeat yourself. He stood, “You telling me you didn’t even have the decency to think about me? To get me something to help me unwind after a long day?”

You shook your head and he spoke again.

“Now I have to wait for you?” He raised his voice and then lowered it again, which made it worse, “You are an ungrateful piece of shit. I’ve taken you in and looked after you-”

–

Your eyes snapped open, trying to push the thoughts back again.

“Fuck off.” You spoke, standing and walking towards the fridge for another drink.

Hours later, the flashbacks still poured in at random no matter how hard you tried to drink them away.

You sighed, unwillingly pulling your phone out of your pocket and your thumb hovering over Bucky’s number. You slammed your fist on the table and went to the fridge for another drink, the last thing you want to do is have someone else here. Especially now.

You groaned and downed your drink, clicking the call button before you could think about it and raised it towards your ear while getting up for yet another drink.

“Y/N?” He answered on the third ring.

“Hey.” You spoke into the phone, closing the fridge.

“How are you?” He spoke again, softly.

You sighed a little into the phone, cracking open your drink and taking a sip, pausing. “Look-” You spoke finally, after a minute of silence, “I told you I’d call if I was… anyways. I did.” You waited for a moment and then you heard him breathe, “This was a stupid idea, I’ll talk to you later.” You closed your eyes and hung up the phone, throwing it over onto your recliner on the other side of the room.

Another drink later, there was a knock on your door. You groaned and waited for them to leave or figure out they were at the wrong door but it came again- you stood up and angrily threw open your door with a, “What?”

Your eyes met those of Bucky who didn’t wait at all, just stepped inside, shut your door and pulled you into a hug. You paused, wanting to back away or joke but instead you burst into tears.

He held you for a long time like that, eventually moving over to the couch and stroking your hair, staying with you overnight.

–

He had done this a half a dozen times over the last month and you had finally told him, bit by bit, why you were like this. You told him how long ago it had happened, how long it had lasted and what were the kinds of things that you were used to from it.

Instead of insisting you shouldn’t have stayed or judged you or told you to calm down about it, he calmly listened, nodded his head and stroked your hair until you calmed down and fell asleep.

Eventually, he talked you into moving into the Avengers building with everyone, away from the shitty area of town you thought you deserved. He stayed with you most nights and became a person you needed to see and share things with.

He was one of the people that helped you get over your darkest thoughts, year by year- and someone who had never let you down.

—————–

It was a few hours off and the ride turned out to have a lot of nagging and teasing which took your mind off of darker thoughts that seemed to be edging in today, as much as you wished they wouldn’t.

Arriving at the hotel, you both went in and got situated in the room- the one you would be looking out of.

No one had told you it only had one bed in it, or that the bed was going to be ten feet away from the lookout spot where you were supposed to be gaining intel from.

You sighed as you threw your bag down and raided the mini fridge, grabbing an expensive can of beer and sitting down in a chair to look through the room service menu.

“You want something to eat?” You asked without peering up over the menu.

“Sure- just get two of whatever you’re getting. That includes that drink of yours.”

“Coming right up.” You winked over to him before turning towards the phone and placing an order. You walked over towards the mini fridge again and grabbed another can and set it down in front of Bucky, helping him with the equipment.

“So who’s going to be on first watch?” Bucky asked, opening his can after you were done setting up.

“I’ll be on both watches.” You mumbled, raising the can to your lips again.

He chuckled before realizing you were serious, “Oh come on, doll. You have to get some sleep.”

You sighed and thanked room service for their impeccable timing, not wanting to start an argument. You stood and strode over to the door, opening it and bringing the cart inside yourself and nodding a thanks before bolting the door shut again.

Looking under the lids, you laughed. “I think I went a little overboard with the quantity.”

Bucky stood and rubbed his hands together, “Good, I’m hungry.”

You went back to joking and eating and drinking while keeping a lookout and soon it got late.

“I’ll take first watch, okay?” Bucky stated, nodding towards the bed. “At least try for a couple hours.”

You sighed, going to the bathroom to get ready for bed. You came out and laid down, staring at the end table for a while. You were determined not to let those thoughts and memories come back- you had been working so hard for so long to get rid of them.

At some point, you must of dozed off because you woke with a start and a panicked breath.

“Woah, you okay doll?” Bucky asked from the other side of the room and you passed by him to get to the bathroom.

You slid down the wall and into a ball, shutting your eyes and rocking slightly.

“Stop-” You whispered to yourself, “He can’t hurt you anymore.” You tried to stay calm but you could feel the tears coming on, afraid that Bucky would hear you outside of the room.

He lightly tapped the door after another minute and you shouted, your voice cracking, “I’m fine.”

“Doll-”

“Keep a lookout.” You said back in a harsh tone, lowering your head into your hands.

Another moment later there was a splintering sound and your head snapped back up, seeing Bucky at the door- he had broken the area around the lock.

“Don’t you understand what ‘I’m fine’ is?” You asked, an unfortunate tear running down your cheek.

“Don’t you understand I know what a fake ‘I’m fine’ is?” He asked back, stepping towards you.

Your breath caught, “Please, leave.” You asked, more desperation than anything in your voice.

He stopped moving towards you and knelt down so you two were eye level. His brows were furrowed and his expression worried. “What’s wrong?”

“Nothing.” You growled back to him, your face returning back to its position in your hands as you focused on breathing, the impending panic attack coming in. “Leave.” You said again, this time much weaker as the start of it came on.

Your mind lost its focus, a million thoughts crashing in on you at once as you remembered things you wanted forgotten with every fiber of your being. Your breath shortened and you flung your legs out to try and let your lungs get more air.

“Doll-” Your eyes snapped to him, waiting to see him mocking you, “Breathe in-” He waited and you did so, “You’re okay,” He stated and then he motioned for you to breathe out. He asked you over and over to do this and after five minutes or so your breathing returned closer to normal, the panic lowering a bit.

You waited and sniffled a little, “How did you know that would work?”

He met your eyes, “You aren’t the only one with panic attacks.”

You paused, letting that sink in. “One of Earth’s mightiest Avengers has troubles too?”

He snorted but his face went back to worry, “Whatever it is you’re going through, you shouldn’t be alone through it.” He scooted closer, and he was only an arms length away. “You never have to tell me what it is that’s causing it but let me help you.” He asked, his face sill soft, unmocking.

“Why make my problems yours?”

“I’m asking you to.” He responded without skipping a beat, his hand reaching out towards you and you flinched away. He immediately retracted his hand, trying to coax you into a safe feeling.

—

Once returning from the mission, Bucky didn’t mention what happened in front of anyone. He did, however, turn to you and ask you to promise something in front of your building.

“What?” You turned around, facing the door.

“That if you need me for any reason, you’ll call me. Even when you don’t want to- especially then.” He spoke softly again.

You paused, thinking about just walking into the building without answering him. He probably sensed this and grabbed your wrist with a little squeeze.

Your eyes shut, another memory popping into your head from before. “Fine.” You whispered, shaking loose from his grasp before walking inside- not looking back.

You rubbed your face after locking your door and throwing your bag onto the couch.

You should be over this, why were you reverting? You went into the kitchen and grabbed a beer out of the fridge before sitting on the couch, lost in thought.

–

“Y/N, come here now.” He had spoken and you instantly did as he asked. He smiled as his arm wrapped around you. “Be a good girl and grab me a drink.”

You nodded, leaping up from your spot towards the kitchen. Opening the door you noticed there were no more left and a cold chill ran over you. You grabbed your keys from the table and walked back into the front room. “I have to run to the store-”

“What?” He asked, his attention snapping back towards you. You shrank back a little and tried to repeat yourself. He stood, “You telling me you didn’t even have the decency to think about me? To get me something to help me unwind after a long day?”

You shook your head and he spoke again.

“Now I have to wait for you?” He raised his voice and then lowered it again, which made it worse, “You are an ungrateful piece of shit. I’ve taken you in and looked after you-”

–

Your eyes snapped open, trying to push the thoughts back again.

“Fuck off.” You spoke, standing and walking towards the fridge for another drink.

Hours later, the flashbacks still poured in at random no matter how hard you tried to drink them away.

You sighed, unwillingly pulling your phone out of your pocket and your thumb hovering over Bucky’s number. You slammed your fist on the table and went to the fridge for another drink, the last thing you want to do is have someone else here. Especially now.

You groaned and downed your drink, clicking the call button before you could think about it and raised it towards your ear while getting up for yet another drink.

“Y/N?” He answered on the third ring.

“Hey.” You spoke into the phone, closing the fridge.

“How are you?” He spoke again, softly.

You sighed a little into the phone, cracking open your drink and taking a sip, pausing. “Look-” You spoke finally, after a minute of silence, “I told you I’d call if I was… anyways. I did.” You waited for a moment and then you heard him breathe, “This was a stupid idea, I’ll talk to you later.” You closed your eyes and hung up the phone, throwing it over onto your recliner on the other side of the room.

Another drink later, there was a knock on your door. You groaned and waited for them to leave or figure out they were at the wrong door but it came again- you stood up and angrily threw open your door with a, “What?”

Your eyes met those of Bucky who didn’t wait at all, just stepped inside, shut your door and pulled you into a hug. You paused, wanting to back away or joke but instead you burst into tears.

He held you for a long time like that, eventually moving over to the couch and stroking your hair, staying with you overnight.

–

He had done this a half a dozen times over the last month and you had finally told him, bit by bit, why you were like this. You told him how long ago it had happened, how long it had lasted and what were the kinds of things that you were used to from it.

Instead of insisting you shouldn’t have stayed or judged you or told you to calm down about it, he calmly listened, nodded his head and stroked your hair until you calmed down and fell asleep.

Eventually, he talked you into moving into the Avengers building with everyone, away from the shitty area of town you thought you deserved. He stayed with you most nights and became a person you needed to see and share things with.

He was one of the people that helped you get over your darkest thoughts, year by year- and someone who had never let you down.

—————–

Permanent Tags:

@i-regret-this-already, @breezy1415, @seninjakitey, @imboredsueme, @courtneychicken, @marriedtopeterparker, @imeannooffensebabybut, @marie-lestowell, @cassiopeia-barrow, @daphne-fandom-writing, @notmyfault404, @i-larb-spooderman, @aussiearies
trail.content_abstract:
Bucky x Reader (ish?)

Warnings: Drinking, swearing, dark thoughts, thoughts of depression and just all around sad theme. 

So this is a request I got and I pulled from some personal experiences- I hope this is close to what you were looking for, anon. Also, as a side thing- this brought out a little dark side to me that I don’t like and I’ve been working really hard on getting away from- so I’m going to limit the dark requests for the moment- I hope everyone understands! :)

anonymous asked:

could you do a bucky reader where she has a bad dream and then she wakes up and it brings back bad memories like a form a ptsd but from emotional abuse? and she feels all panicky and then bucky comes in and looks after her?

Masterlist   ||   Ko-Fi

——————-

You had been part of the Avengers for months now but had refused to live at the compound. It had been a little tough since you had to travel back and forth often but it was your wish. You hadn’t lived with someone since… no.

You shook your head, trying to clear it before entering the conference room you were supposed to meet everyone in.

“You alright?” A soft voice came from behind and you jumped a little.

“Jesus, Buck.” You nudged his arm, “How long you been standing there?”

He shrugged and nudged you back, “Long enough.” He smiled as his eyes met yours.

You turned back towards the door and cleared your throat, “Let’s do this.”

summary: Home is where I am with you - an excerpt from Chapter 2, Pepper flies a suite and battles a “new” enemy.
title: Home is where I am with you - an excerpt from Chapter 2, Pepper flies a suite and battles a “new” enemy.
body:
So this fic takes place after Civil War while Tony is off with the guardians in a related fic called “a long way home”. here is a bit of what I have so far. 

A Long Way Home - https://archiveofourown.org/works/14116782/chapters/32527500

Home is Where I am with you - https://archiveofourown.org/works/15694077/chapters/36469950

~*~

“There is a small disturbance at a Stark industries lab in Taiwan that you could handle without much effort.” Friday said.  Bringing up a projection. Pepper frowned. Then looked at her cell phone.

“Why hasn’t anyone called me?” she asked.

“Cell Reception in that area has gone down.” Friday replied. “Shall I alert the Accords members of your imminent arrival?”

Pepper growled and stalked her way to the armour. If Tony could blast his way out of a cave with nothing more than a flamethrower attached to his arm, than she could fly his highly complicated suites. Damn the man.

Her HUD lit up with the basic control mechanisms. “Just let me know what you need, I will try to help in anyway I can.” Friday came through in the earpiece.

“Thanks. Fri. Let’s do this.”

summary: Okay but like what if... We know that after the snap half of everything disappeared, so that means A LOT of people lost someone...
body:
Okay but like what if…

We know that after the snap half of everything disappeared, so that means A LOT of people lost someone they love, lost their parents, lovers, siblings, best friends AND PETS!

So what if, the rest of the population of the universe just goes ‘oh hell no’ and rallies together. So in the final fight of the remaining avengers vs Thanos, everything is on the ground, they’re barely still alive. Heck maybe one of two of them have already died.

And as they’re all out of breath, clinging on to life because they have to win. They hear shouting in the distance. Everyone stops fighting for a moment and in the distance they see.

A person.

Which becomes hundreds of people, which become thousands which grows to too many people for them to be able to tell. And in the distance they hear someone shout.

“CHARGE!”

All of the sudden they’re running, Tony (if he’s still alive) realizes what they’re doing and is about to tell them to stop, he doesn’t want anymore people to get hurt. But another avenger grabs him, they all get out of the way because they could get run over here.

And they barely make it out of the line of fire before a few gunshots ring out, they don’t do more than annoy Thanos but that doesn’t stop them from continuing.

By the time the first people reach the big grape the avengers can see that everyone is here. Old people who lost their grandchildren in the snap, teenagers who lost their best friends, everyone who lost their cat or dog.

Everyone is almost on top of Thanos, when one gets shaken off two more replace them. Steve notices that he’s raising his gauntlet behind him, none of the people can reach it.

But the superheroes can.

Steve shouts to the other avengers who all notice it. They join in, being careful not to hurt their new allies. As Thanos is distracted by the people he only barely notices that the Infinity Gauntlet is being pulled off as people are climbing up to his face.

They pull it off, Thanos yells as he realizes whats happened. But before he can do anything Captain Marvel puts in on, she waves the gauntlet and Thanos disappears.

It’s silent, everyone faces the avengers. Captain Marvel smiles tiredly.

“We won,”
